column4: why won't nautlus show one of my local mounted drives? it shows every other one, except for my "winshare" drive. is it because it's fat32?
probably.  if you made it skinny32, it might want to see it.
anyway to force it to show up?
you could try to mount it manually.  check "mount --help"
it mounts fine. it just doesn't show up in Nautilus
something like "mount -t vfat /dev/hdaX /mnt/windows" or whatever where X is the partition number.
oh
uh...  where is it mounted?
/media, like everything else
and yes, i can read and write files to it
not the point.  is there anything on it?
oh yes, tons of stuff. and i can access it all
but it just won't show up in nautilus?
correct

yes, for all intents and purposes, it works perfect. wait, let me amend my problem. it doesn't show up on the left hand side in nautilus, in the "shortcut" tree menu. i can browse to it by going to /media, but i can't see it listed in the shortcuts
browse to /media/ and drag the folder to the shortcuts side (usually the bottom half)
nope. this is in tree view, btw
no clue how to get it there.
all well, no one else does either :P i find it very odd. oh well, thanks anyway
i'm looking at my .nautilus directory in my home folder.  i suggest you do the same
you might find help in that folder
thanks, ill try that
could, of course, be that Trash was in my history, but you never know...
yeah...  no dice finding Desktop in there
